text: [Music]
hello I am Ru a cloud engineer here at
AWS office in Dublin today I will show
you how to use AWS identity and asset
management identity Center permission
sets to provide users and groups access
to an AWS account let's get
started first we must create a
permission set logging in into the
identity center console in the
navigation pen under multi account
permissions choose permission sets then
choose create permission
set on the select permission set type
page under permission set type choose
previne permission set under the policy
for predefine permission set choose V
access and choose next on the specifi
permission set details choose next on
the review and create screen review the
details and choose create you will see a
message that the view only access
permission set was successfully created
next we must assign this permission set
to AWS
accounts in the navigation pen under
multi account permission choose AWS
accounts on the AWS account page select
AWS account you want to assign single
sign on access to then choose assign
users or groups on the assigned users
and groups page under selected users and
group choose the user that you want to
create a permission set for then choose
next select the permission set and click
next on the review and submit assignment
stage review the details and choose
submit you will see a message that the
account was provisioned
successfully now let's verify that the
user as the view only accet
permission in the navigation pen choose
dashboard under the summary choose the
AWS assess portal
URL log to the assess portal with your
IM identity Center username and password
choose the account drop down list to
view the view only access permissions
and now you know how to use IM identity
Center permission sets to provide users
and groups access to an AWS account
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
